Represents a displacement in 4D space.

Methods

CreateDirection(in double, in double, in double)

Constructs a direction vector.
public static Vector4 CreateDirection(in double x, in double y, in double z)

Parameters

x double
Value for the X component.
y double
Value for the Y component.
z double
Value for the Z component.

Returns

Vector4

Remarks

Note that direction vectors have their `w` component set to zero and are thus unaffected by translations.

Remarks

Note that point "vectors have their `w` component set to zero and are thus unaffected by translations.

Cross3(Vector4) 

public Vector4 Cross3(Vector4 b)

Parameters

b Vector4

Returns

Vector4

Cross3(in Vector4, in Vector4)

Performs a cross product on two `Vector4` instances disregarding the `W` component. Essentially treating `a` and `b` as 3d vectors. The resulting 3d vector is wrapped as a 4d direction vector (`w` = 1).
public static Vector4 Cross3(in Vector4 a, in Vector4 b)

Parameters

a Vector4
b Vector4

Returns

Vector4
